text: Love love love la Gloria, glad I can get my fix while I am here in Vegas!   Mangonada margarita is a must, along with bistec tacos!
Crappy small portions. Quesidilla is tiny and terrible quality. Greasy and tastes microwaved. Stay away from here!

If I could give zero stars that would still be to much. After making are way to get some good fast food , we stumbled on this place and I do not recommend this to anyone unless you want to have a bad day and an uncomfortable meal.

After ordering food for my family , I asked to upgrade the aqua fresca drink , the cashier said they only offer one size  so I acknowledged and that was perfectly ok no big deal. Until her rude associate named Genelle comes up in front of us and starts to pour herself and aqua fresca in a LARGE CUP , the size I asked to upgrade too, I then asked how come I couldn't upgrade I was willing to pay she rudely said this is for me only and just walks to the back ! 
I let it go and just kept my comments to myself . It didn't stop there, as we waited for our plates she kept looking at us and making comments and laughing. As soon as our plates were done she just called our name and threw the plates down, didn't even bother to check the receipts as she was for everyone before us. At that I point I was pissed . We just walked away and STILL DIDN'T SAY ONE THING . As we were eating it felt as if there was a hawk just watching , she kept looking and making comments to another employ at the ice cream stand next to her . . 

After we finished I approached her specifically and read her badge and asked her to contact her manager . The manager did come and as a manager should , she heard me out offered an apology and asked if she could get us anything. I  didn't want anything nor was I trying to get anything. But being a manager myself I feel it's important if employees are being the way she was I also would like to know . She has affected your business I might only be a little dollar amount to what that business makes a day, but imagine all the other people who have dealt with her and have decided to never spend money there again. The dollars add up pretty quickly . Vegas is based on recommendations , tourists read to research where they want to and don't want to go. I hope she gets a lesson in customer service and Vegas being so competitive I hope management takes care of this situation before they lose more money ..
Don't eat here. just don't. $15 for a burrito that tastes like it came from the back dumpster. go next door and eat a pastry at Starbucks.

I haven't tried the food, yet. But I'm so excited about the Prickly Pear Margarita ($12.99) I had to come & shout from the rooftops how happy I am to have a taste of San Antonio right here at home. I couldn't get enough of these on the Riverwalk. I've missed them terribly and these at La Gloria are the real deal.
nice reasonable prices nice friendly service good carne asada fries
Best food ive ever had salsa bar is so yummy .i had the fish tacos and they were delicious

Just got a Mangonada, which I love don't get me wrong, but to add a gratuity on a drink when I'm having it served to me in a restaurant is not right, and you didn't even let me know?? I didn't see a sign stating this would be added...then you have a tip cup next to the register for people to leave you tips??? What is the gratuity for? Not worth the money to go here again.

This def not authentic mexican. charge extra for sour cream even tho i didnt get meat. super small burrito for $10, kill me. go to a street vendor and get something ten times more authentic and delicious and cheaper.

Really great food and drinks. Loved the asada tacos (order of 3), the fish ceviche, and the queso dip. The ceviche was very fresh. Didn't love the pastor tacos cuz they come with pineapple and I'm not one for sweet, but if you like that combination of sweet and savory, you'll close them. The mangonada drink is a must!!
IDK if it was because I was so HANGRY, but the steak tacos were delish... a little greasy and only had 1 tortilla but i loved it! Free salsa bar! Will absolutely go back!!!

Came here on a Sunday afternoon around 2 to grab a quick bite.

I ordered a chicken burrito without lettuce and extra pico di Gallo in the burrito.

It took like 5-7 minutes for my burrito to come out. And when I got it the tortilla was dry and semi hard , there was no extra pico di Gallo in the burrito. The chicken was very dry. The only thing good here was the salsa that they give you , I had to use that to give flavor to the burrito . And it was kinda small . I'd skip this place and head to the pizza shop or sandwich place .
Really?  We ordered the chicken quesadilla for $9.99. What we got was two 4" quesadillas with a tiny bit of chicken and cheese.  That was it...  Totally not worth it!  Avoid!!

The cashier Tina H showed very bad service when attending us, we asked her if they had combos, and she said not for everyone with a bad way, the Mexican food did not have a good flavor, the high price to be fast food a bad experience

As a San Antonio native, I have to tell everyone: there's nothing like Tex-Mex. Sorry Vegas, you have a lot of good taquerias and all, but the nuances that make it just right aren't here. Luckily, La Gloria just opened so I can get my hometown taco and margarita fix every so often, without shelling out for  a plane ticket. 

Menu is small: about seven varieties of tacos (three to an order), two ceviches, and some small items like quesadillas, and the rest of the menu is aguas frescas and margaritas. Opted for the Alambre tacos- beef with grilled peppers and onions. So tasty, so fresh, good quality.

 But lord, I wish they hadn't opened on the Strip because prices are literally double what they should be. At $10 for three MINI tacos, it's about a buck a bite. At least give me normal sized tacos, guys! The palm-sized minis are a mean trick, even moreso when they're tearing slightly before I even get them to my mouth.

I've tasted old truck tires better than this steak meat. 

I will give them 2 stars instead of 1 just in case their chicken is good. Havent tried.

The food court in Caesars has a variety of options. I come to La Gloria every time I'm at Caesars and if you get the ceviche...you won't be disappointed. It's fresh and surprisingly awesome. 

Everything else is whatever, but get the ceviche and you won't be mad at me. It's white fish, white onion, cilantro, lime, jalapeño and salt (says my palate). It comes with tostadas so you can scoop the ceviche. Very tasty.

La Gloria - Mexican tacos, quesadillas + burritos in the food court at Caesar's Palace. 

The steak ("bistec") tacos were very good. The order is served as 3 small tacos, made of corn tortillas. These tortillas were quite tasty. 

Their chicken quesadilla is also delicious. The chicken tasted very fresh. 

The nachos and queso (cheese) were amazing! The portion is huge. The cheese dip is smooth and so tasty. 

We ordered our meals as combos (Combo #2) which consisted of the tacos (or quesadilla), a side dish (nachos) and a beer. Each combo cost $19

The service was OK. The cashier forgot my request for "no onions" but I guess it didn't matter as onions weren't in the tacos anyway. 

The food is MUCH better than Taco Bell, so don't assume tacos are tacos. Food was tasty and fresh and portions were good.
Yuck! Waited 15 minutes to get cold soggy fish tacos. I realize this is a food court but geez this was awful!

I came here because we stay at the Caesars hotel and the kids wanted Mexican food the food is good but they have 2 cooks that are old I told the cashier I want everything on the side and she was fine with it but as soon as the chefs got our order them 2 started complaining I didn't see what the big deal was and the bad part is when you it hear them talking about you and your order. Customer service is 0 but the food is delicious.
Probably the worst quesadilla i have ever had.   Not very big and served on small corn tortillas.  And, it was also super expensive.   This place is not worth your time.

I had a chicken burrito with everything and it was ok.  The meat didn't taste like it was seasoned which is good at least it wasn't not too salty but I want sum flavor.  The best part was the $5 margarita.  The cashier was trying to get me to add another $2.  No thanks.  Plus they automatically include a top.  Not cool.  Their condiment bar needs help or eliminate it.  This spot is located within other. restaurants.
Terrible staff and customer service. They act like they are doing you a favor by taking your order. I don't care if the good is great or not. They won't get my business again.

Summary: Good steak tacos. Good guacamole. Reasonable prices.

This place seems to have a worse general opinion than it would otherwise deserve. Granted, it's a food court in MGM with a bunch of other places, but really it did not come off as being significantly worse than what would be expected or desired from such an establishment in such a location.

I ordered the steak tacos, which were reasonable priced, tasty, and excellent quality. There was no gristle or under/over-cooking and the tortillas were nice and toasty. The salsas available complemented well, and the guacamole was also pretty good (albeit a little citrusy). The whole meal cost about $15 and was definitely filling. It's not the best Mexican food I have ever had, but it is far from the worst either. Certainly worth checking out.

Stopped by for lunch with a serious craving for tacos. Al Pastor tacos are one of my favorites and La Gloria did not disappoint. The order came with 3. I usually want more than that, but the size of the order was just enough. Very tasty. Will Definitly be back to try those Nachos.

Had the Al Pastor tacos. Cost about $10 for three small street tacos. A bit pricey but you're at the food court at the Ceasar's so can't exactly expect budget prices. The tacos were good and had a sweet finish due to the small chunks of pineapple get out on top. I would have liked the savory was of the meat to come through a bit more. Also, could have been a little hotter temp wise. An adequate meal if you want something fast to hold you over.
We ordered 2 sangrias, and they charged us an extra 20% as gratuity! For a counter service pick up of 2 drinks! Disgusting.

Stopped by for a quick bite before a show.  There was a short line that moved quickly.  I ordered the fish taco combo with a melon agua fresca.  Food came out fairly quickly and tasted great.  Price was a little high for what I got but that is to be expected in a casino.  This is one of the better places in the Caesars food court.

I don't see why such bad reviews. Either I'm off my rocker or have crappy taste buds. Some of the reviewers should have honestly lowered their expectations and been a bit more fair to this company. It's a food court, no your tacos will not be brought out to you from the finest chef in Mexico City. It WILL be cooked and ordered through great people who were super friendly and happy to help as needed. It's a bit pricey but it's on the Strip. I'm a local and know better deals but I liked the food. I was going to get tacos for $9 or so but a $16 combo includes a side and drink and any entree. Sooooooo I got the more expensive burrito for the all in cost. *brushing shoulders off* Chips and Queso was good, burrito was filling.
Best tacos here in vegas in caesars palace deserie was a great cashier and excellent service will definitely be coming back here
Closing time is 4:30 am. It is now 4;25 and they won't serve us. Is this sponsored by the corporate office closing early? 5 people in line and they turned them away.

I specifically requested to have fresh salsa on the side and no sour cream with guac instead (and agreed to pay extra). All my friends got their orders before me and one ordered from the restaurant next door. Once I was finally called they gave me my fries with NO guac and with fresh salsa after I requested no fresh salsa. I was extremely hungry and we all know how hanger can get the best of us.

My friend were making fun of me for trying tacos in a food court, but after living in California for the last year, I find myself in a perpetual state of craving Mexican food. And I have to say that these tacos were legit. I had the bistec especial, and it was three solid, beef tacos. However, the serving of chips is ENORMOUS, and is really too much unless you are planning on sharing. But three good tacos with drink for $10 is a pretty sweet deal.

Another fine addition to the food court at Caesars Palace located across from the world famous Colosseum. This place serves up some great Mexican street food dishes. La Gloria is hip Mexican restaurant in San Antonio that made it to Vegas by Chef Johnny Hernandez. 

We ordered tons of food. I wanted it all. Everything was super fresh. We got chips and queso, ceviche, bistec and al pastor tacos, chicken quesadilla, and a couple of drinks. The food was very flavorful and tasty. Try all the salsas. My favorite was the Al pastor with the little pieces of piña. And the Mangonada with mango and cantaloupe was so refreshing after working the entire day. We left so full, we had to walk around the forum shops to rest our stomachs. I made a joke with my dining partner that this place is like Border Grill light.

This is a Mexican shop in the Forum Shops (Caesar's) food court. Once again since this is a food court, don't set your expectations super high. Given that the other restaurants in the casino are rather pricey, the food court is your best bet if you want to stay under $15 per person.

The tacos al pastor are just okay. The meat was a bit dry and didn't really have sauce. 

I really liked the guacamole and chips (it was $5.99 for chips and guacamole and a generous helping). The guacamole tasted fresh and nicely salted. There's also a generous selection of salsa and limes you can pick up.

i'm not surprise this place has 2 stars. my sister ordered a $5 margarita. and i got the mangonada margarita. first of all they charge me $2.16 for gratuity??? i never heard of such thing for a fast food place. i should've just cancelled right then & there. then my drank was pure ice. super bland. my sister's $5 margarita tasted more like alcohol. i told the guy that made it, and he didn't even care. then i complained. Lol. then he just gave me the same shit my sister had. but a LITTLE bigger size.... $15???!! what a rip. i didn't care to argue. whatevs. there's better places. fat tuesday!

Stopped by to grab a bite while waiting for everyone. The cashier was nice but the supporting staff was extremely rude. The food was nothing to rave about. The al pastor was too sour. However the agua fresca lemonade was great.

Honestly, I wish I would have utilized Yelp before eating here. The rating is almost low enough to get the picture Accross. The food isn't what kills this place. The food isn't awful, it's just something you might find a middle age white woman who's never had authentic Mexican food before serving her family on Taco Tuesday. The price, $60 in my encounter, is far too expensive for what you get. An undersized burrito and nachos with nacho cheese instead of real cheese. The menu says "cheese" not "nacho cheese" which makes all the difference in the world if you want quality Mexican food, not Taco Bell... The only redeeming quality of La Gloria is the staff. In my 2 second encounter with them they were at least nice. Ultimately the price for what you get was so disappointing that I had to award them a 1 star.
They have a great $5 margarita and you can even make it a combo if you want. I had the carne a sada fries they are to die for you must try.
Me and my family come to Las Vegas every year.We love the food here .Come check this place out it's the best ..love love love love it..

Average and we were starving. Dry and really nothing special about it. The steak burrito was $11 but what else do you expect in Vegas. We had to smoother it with condiments to add flavor to it. We had to grab something quick before the concert. Not worth the money but they were fast hence the 2 stars. We split it was 2 people
Worst beef burrito I ever had, beef is burned and totally awful taste when beef is crunchy in my burrito, not recommend to any Mexican food lovers

For $9.99 an order of 3 tacos, I did not see or taste any grilled fish as there was a large amount of shredded cabbage so I thought the fish may have been buried - No such luck :(  The tacos al pastor came with lots of meat but not tasty compared to the mission district in San Francisco or San Rafael, CA.  Friendly service, food taste was average for the al pastor, fish tacos a rip sorry to say.

The burrito was very skimpy AND I never have been to a authentic Mexican restaurant where they cut your burrito in half at an angle as though it's a wrap! The chicken had no flavor, was chopped into small bitty pieces and they hardly gave you any. There was more shredded lettuce than anything else. The limp shredded lettuce is not even hand shredded. It is a bagged shredded lettuce because you can taste the off flavor of the preservatives that is added to bagged shredded lettuce. I felt like I was eating an awful salad in a wrap. This burrito had no girth and substance. It was the flimsiest, unflavorful, expensive and smallest burrito I've ever had at a authentic Mexican restaurant.  The tortilla they used was cold and chewy like a generic American brand. Nothing authentic from a local Mexican brand manufacturer. It wasn't soft and warm like a burrito should feel in your hands.

I am a Las Vegas local. If this restaurant was anywhere else in Las Vegas they would have  closed  their doors due to lack of business. No local would return after the first visit and you would have to rely on the locals to keep you open. The only reason you are still in business at the food court in Caesars Palace because it is tourists that are going there and you don't have to rely on them returning. Tourists go to your spot in the food court for a quick bite not because they recognize your name as a chain. They leave liking the food or not liking the food. There experience ends there. You only have 51 yelp reviews so tourists don't care or feel it's necessarily to rate your restaurant. There is no other Mexican restaurant in the food court so you have no competition. However, for a Las Vegas local eating at this restaurant somewhere off the strip you bet there would be plenty more negative reviews because there are so many excellent authentic Mexican restaurants that you would have to stand side by side in competition. I understand your rent must be high and that's why you charge $9.99 for a lousy burrito. Come on, I know wholesale food prices for chicken, beans, lettuce, tomatoes, onions and cilantro is nothing. Shame on you for serving skimpy, poor quality food and passing it off as authentic Mexican at that price!

Great fish taco combo.  3 fish tacos, chips and guacamole plus a 16oz beer your choice for 17.99.  Great for on the run and need a fast fresh bite so you can get back to the roulette table. Inside the food court at Ceasars.  I say check it out.

La Gloria is located in the Forum Shops Food Court.

I had gotten Smashburger, my cousins decided for La Gloria.

They decided to give me a chicken taco. I remember it was chicken. Why? It was dry, had no taste, and looked unappetizing. For the Yelp? For the Yelp! If I recall it was ~ $6 for a pair of 3 tacos, which makes no sense. $2 for that sad thing you call a taco? What? Why?

Make sure you get more salsa or hot sauce. Something that will give it flavor. They have some on there but it's not enough.

To their credit though, they do put a lot of meat on there. It's just... something I would not get or eat again. 

Expensive food, but you know.. It's Vegas.

Oh. My. Gawwwwwdddd these tacos are INCREDIBLE! How does this place only have 2.5 stars?! Hands down the best tacos I have ever had. EVER! The beef and chicken tacos are both so amazing. You have to give this place a try!

I don't really understand why this business doesn't get more stars. I had a great experience! Their queso is delicious, I had their bowl & it was great. Friendly service & a fresh salsa bar too! The only reason I'm
Giving 4/5 is because on their sign it says "tacos tequilas tostadas ceviche margaritas" The ceviche drew me in & they actually don't have it :( lunch was great though!
We stopped in for a bite after attending a concert at the Coliseum.  We really enjoyed the chicken nachos; the guacamole was very good.

Good Food Court Mexican Food.

I Guess From All The Drinking & The Sun From Rehab I Wanted A Hardy Meal. 

Not Bad. $9.99 Burrito.

Had Something Totally Different. 

French Fries With Chicken | Pico DW Gallon | Sour Cream | Guacamole | Black Beans | Con Queso. $8.99

That Was Really Good. I Would Come Back. 

Vegas Life. Who Knew
Good carne asada burrito and the salsas were tasy as well. Salsa verde very good.

Super expensive for no reason i got a burrito and there was no flavoring at all i could taste the lettuce  tomatoes and beans with each bite that's about it portions were small for the price you'd think if your gonna pay over 15 bucks you'd get a big meal not with these guys sorry..

The fish tacos are horrible. Cold tortillas, no flavor, and yucky fish. If you are debating between La Gloria and another one of the restaurants in the food court go with the other.  I ended up getting Smash Burger.

Total rip off. I have been here a few times now and every time it's far overpriced for what it is. Most recently I ordered 2 orders of the chips and queso and they gave me 1 order and told me to split it between boxes. Are you kidding me?! $25 for 2 orders of chips and queso and an order of chicken tacos and you can't even give me a full 2 orders of chips and queso?! Never coming here again.

First of all, you have to take Vegas reviewers who eat in the food court with a grain of salt. If they were winners, they'd be eating at the steak house.
I had a great meal here. I had grilled fish tacos, amazing guacamole, and two super yummy infused drinks. The cashier saved me four bucks and got me more food.

Just pick something else.  I stopped here on the way to a show - convenient location to quick have something to eat.  The food was not good.  Long wait.  Too many other great places to eat on the strip.
Bought a variety of quesadillas.  They tasted awful as they looked.  Service was poor and of course over priced being located at Ceasars.  I will not be back.

I live in San Antonio Texas. If you copy La Gloria San Antonio and paste it in Caesars Las Vegas, this is what you get. Food was identical to SA location. Drinks were amazing. Staff was friendly and helpful. The menu is a shortened menu from the original but the $5 margaritas and combo specials they offer are outstanding. When I return to Las Vegas I will make it a point to stop by for a snack or lunch.

Low wait times. Diamond & Seven Stars receive front of line courtesy.
Food was good tasting, portion size is small for prices. 
Plus a small salsa bar: which is nice! 
Lots of open soda machines in the food court. 
Very nice & friendly workers inside La Gloria.

Located right in the food court of Caesars Palace is this Mexican spot.  We came for a visit during the mid day in the middle of the week and it wasn't busy at all.

The people working here were busy amongst themselves in the back of the kitchen.  Honestly, because they have so many decorations and food display items for their sauces, etc; they could barely see anyone standing in line waiting to order.  Which was the reason for me having to get their attention by waving my hands in the air and voicing out, "hello, hello?"

Anyway, I was the only customer (I only ordered one dish) and it took about 20 minutes for my Tacos to finish.  BTW, I ordered the fish taco dish that contained 3 soft tacos with fried white fish, lettuce, tomato, and some seasoned sauce that didn't taste seasoned.  The dish was okay, it lacked flavor and was plain to me.

I was a little disappointed because they're marketed as a street food market for Mexican food when actually it didn't taste anything like that.  They have a lot of drink specials for margaritas but I didn't order any so I can't comment on that.  They have cool decorations and sauces though but next time I'll visit the Romen spot next door.

Worst place I've been to in Vegas.  I got the pastor quesadilla and chips with salsa.  First I tried to get the burrito with pastor but since that wasn't on the menu they couldn't make it.... So I get the quesadilla and for $20 I only got 2 pieces with no meat, the chips were stale, and the salsa had no flavor.  Then the cherry on top was the classless service.

The only good thing about this place was that my bottled water was unopened and cold when I got it.

My friend said I had to say something positive.
For being food offered at the food court I found it excellent. Food is tasty and the pricing is fairly decent. I found my food portion satisfying. Will definitely eat here again :)

Just had the Bistec tacos. Totally amazing!! I will be back again before I leave Vegas. I added the cheese to the tacos, probably doesn't even need it. The flavor was so good that I could eat 3 more but in stuffed. They load it up with meat. Great addition was the chips and salsa, very sweet and not hot.

If there was a possibility to put negative stars, I would. 

Waited 20mins then tells me my food is out of stock. Then I see burritos coming that is just all messed up / ripped apart when it is served. 
Only has one cook. As I'm writing this review, I still haven't received my order. 

Just pure disappointment. 3 fish tacos for $10!! Just Absurd. The actual food being served just look very ugly and unappetizing. 

I'm amazed at how this place is allowed to stay In business inside Caesars palace.

It's not the cooks fault, it's more on management, the cook was overwhelmed. Only one person doing prep and cooking then finishing.

My husband and I stumbled across this food court at Cesar's Palace and decide to get a quick bite to eat at Phillips. My husband is obsessed with Micheladas and we had just arrived in Vegas so we were all about getting drinks right away! 

We saw this restaurant next to Phillips and decided to see if they offered Micheladas and they did! He ordered one ofcourse and I tried their margarita. Their Michelada was okay according to my husband definitely not the authentic kind you would find in San Diego and my margarita was a little too sweet for my liking!
The food is OK.  You get what u pay for.  It wasn't amazing.  They do have a $5 Margarita.

Ohh my gosh, this place has the BEST carne asada fries in Vegas! They are located in the food court inside of Caesars Palace and are very reasonable priced. The staff are all friendly, and get your food too you pretty quickly. Whenever I come back to Vegas I make sure to hit up this spot every time!

The portions are big compared to your regular taco place 
Also have agua fresca and margaritas this is a place must go if you like authentic Mexican tacos
The worst Mexican food I've ever had. The quesadilla was so greasy you could hardly eat it. Recommend eating somewhere else in the Caesars food court.
If I could give this place zero stars I would. Ordered the carne asada fries and got what looked like fries swimming in cheese sauce. Fake cheese at that. Overpriced and disgusting.

Food poisoning..................... bad.




Order a Mexican rice bowl, and it was alright.
I love it! Tacos are so good! Everything was perfect here. It was a nice spot to get something to eat in ceasars palace for not a lot of money
This place was garbage. The meat was cooked like2 days ago with no seasoning. Over priced extreme poor service. Do not go. Choose something else. Or just liquor

$40 for tacos filled with lettuce. Come on man! I guess Cesar would die again if he would ever be offered these bland .. ridiculous fish portion to tortilla tacos. Granted it's a Mexican your selling tacos to. My worst Mexican ancestors wouldn't cook shit like this. Your restaurant is called  La Gloria as a mirage to the food we expect to eat. Mind you it's a gloriously high priced crap. I'm giving you a 1 star because I can't find a negative number on my rating. With this kinda food you sell .. you won't get above 3 stars. The end

I ordered a veggie burrito and I could tell the tortilla just came out of the freezer. Every bite was cold. Nothing tasted fresh. Not worth 10 dollars. I give it 2 stars only because it had avocado on it. I go to Vegas multiple times per year and will never order food here again.

My husband and I wanted a quick lunch so we stopped here for a bite. It is locate within a food court inside Caesars casino. 

We ordered chips with salsa to start with. The chips were cheap and came from probably a bag. There were bigger chip pieces so you could enjoy the salsa you scoop onto the chip. You can choose your salsas from the salsa bar. No salsa I tried was impressive but I come from the land of excellent salsa (texas).

I opted for the tacos. You get three tacos but they had to be the same kind (boo!!). I ordered the grilled fish tacos and they informed me it would take additional time to make. No worries, only seven minutes. 

My husband ordered a quesadilla and wasn't impressed. 

If you have any allergies and or food intolerance, they will work with you to ensure you get what you want. 

Note, they sell drinks for purchase and there is seating available in the food court.

Friend recommended eating at the food court inside Caesars Palace before we visited their shops . We had dinner reservations for Javier's that night and just wanted a quick snack at the food court .

So what did we decide to get . Burritos at La Gloria . When we were going to have Mexican food in the upcoming 4 hours for dinner .

You order at cashier , pay, wait for your order . They have a self serve salsa bar that has three salsas, limes, onions. 

All three of us ordered the steak burrito (about $11). It comes with carne asada, lettuce , salsa, avocado , beans . It's a nice size for the price and considering you're in a fancy hotel . 

I asked mine without beans and asked if I could get something else instead . Cashier said yes a bit of guacamole at no charge . The girl who gave me burrito though said I should have been charged though . So oh well .

The beef was ok. I didn't like the lettuce as it made the burrito soggy . The salsa was nice . There is a tiny slice of avocado inside the burrito . 

Overall it was a filling burrito and not a bad purchase for $11 or so. Seating in the food court was tough but be patient and you'll find one .

Horrible food as we had the bistec tacos, nachos and a chicken burrito. All of the above were disgusting, complete waste of money. Make sure to use the open air salsa bar (family tasting with fingers) or stare at the jalapeños that have clearly been out since yesterday. Caesars is much better than this, this place was a scary health hazard. Check it out for yourself, but don't waste your cash.

After a long wait just to order and another long wait to get my food, I get a beef quesidilla where the beef is extremely over cooked and crunchy.  They don't even give you a side of chips for what your paying.  Poor service and poor food, I would give this place  a negative rating if I could. Should have complained to management but too hungry to wait in that long line again. Never eating here again.

I'm from San Antonio Tx & original Restaurant is not bad. No Flavor & Burrito is full of Beans & maybe 2 oz of Beef. Steak Tacos are Tough & Not Very high in quality. I complained to the Manager & they told me Cook was a New Employee. Food Is Overpriced format e 2oz of Tough Cheap Meat for a $ 16.99. They've Got to be Laughing all the way to the Bank, Shame on  Management !!!

I would have given this place zero stars. My first visit to this restaurant at the food court in Caesar's Palace. I had one question about an item on the menu that I was interested in ordering and I was given an attitude. I asked for Taco's and if they come with a combo. Apparently there's two names for an order of tacos. One has cheese and one doesn't have cheese. She mention the names and I didn't understand what they came with. I asked the lady that was helping me to explain each one to me please. The lady's name that was assisting me was Geneil. Her reply to me was do you want cheese or not. I asked again what is the difference between both and are they combo's? She repeated herself do you want cheese or not. I said yes and moved on. She asked "To go or for here?" I said "I said to go" When I received my food it wasn't to go. I asked if I could have this to go. Geneil took the plate back with attitude put it in the box then showed it to the cook for some reason I don't know what he was doing to the food, he was poking at it I couldn't  see really. Then she puts it on a bag twisted close and doesn't even look at me she just drops it in front and walks away. I felt I wasn't being respected I wasn't being shown customer service. I should be receiving eye contact with an apology and have a nice day. That's what you do when you give good customer service. Customer service was terrible. The manager came back after I asked for a refund because I felt like I was being miss treated. The manager doesn't say anything to me just gives me a refund and hands me my receipt. I know Caesar's Palace is better than this. I love this property they have a lot of amazing restaurants, but this food court experience was terrible. I know you guys can get this right and fix the issue.

$5 margarita!
Get the double shot.
Best marg in vegas
Nachos pretty good. Too much for a snack. Wife and I shared

Found in the forum food court of Caesar's palace. I paid $18+ for a cheese quesadilla, chips with queso, and a fountain drink. The quesadilla was a greasy nightmare that I'm sure will not be settling well in my stomach. The chips and queso were OK, nothing spectacular. Ridiculously over priced for what it is. This same food would have cost me less than $10 at a proper sit down Mexican restaurant so it definitely shouldn't cost nearly double in a food court. Save your money and go to a real Mexican place.
I had the carne asada nachos, they were BOMB.com the best part is there melted queso. The cook Norma was very helpful and nice and my food came out quick.

Yes, it is expensive. But come on, this is Vegas, this is the Caesar's Palace Forum shops.

But it is worth it. Because it's good, quality authentic Mexican food.

We have been to the original La Gloria in San Antonio, which is a must-try restaurant if you are ever in the area.

This time, my wife had a craving for Ceviche. I knew it was almost impossible to get ceviche in the middle of a casino. We were surprised by finding La Gloria. We are glad we did. The ceviche was very good, with plenty of fish for the price.

Not a bargain, but good food nonetheless.
